hints.content:
Every time we move right on the number line, we add the distance we move.

$387\redD{+3}=390$

![The same number line as above, with the first arrow labeled plus 3](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/71070f38769e4ae2c37a01651d8529b0a2320499)

Let's keep adding to label the other points on the number line.

$390\purpleD{+10}=400$

![The same number line as above, with the second arrow labeled plus 10](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/6b23596d5d9ce9f126c2c39a4c74752c925a63e6)

[[☃ explanation 1]]

$400\greenD{+20}=420$

![The same number line as above, with the third arrow labeled plus 20](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/539e1e38c7e6d19a54cb994b9049470ac299203f)

[[☃ explanation 1]]

This leads to the same sum because, altogether, that is a distance of:

$\redD{3}+\purpleD{10}+\greenD{20}= \blueD{33}$

![The same number line as above, with the long arrow labeled plus 33 pointing from 387 to 420](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/6bacffcd3b03178831b7992f4dd13442c3c6a385)

This is the completed number line:

![The completed number line with the arrows labeled, from left to right: plus 3, plus 10, and plus 20, and the long arrow labeled plus 33](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/6bacffcd3b03178831b7992f4dd13442c3c6a385)

options.imageAlt: A number line with points at 387, 390, 400, and 420. The first and leftmost arrow, labeled plus 3, goes from 387 to 390. The second, unlabeled, arrow goes from 390 to 400. The third, unlabeled, arrow goes from 400 to 420. A longer arrow labeled plus 33 spans the other three arrows, from 387 to 420.

markers.label: The addend for the second arrow from 390 to 400
The addend for the third arrow from 400 to 420

question.content:
